text: Knowing yourself is the beginning of all wisdom.
author: Aristotle

text: For a man to conquer himself is the first and noblest of all victories.
author: Plato

text: Happiness resides not in possessions, and not in gold, happiness dwells in the soul.
author: Democritus

text: Difficulties are things that show a person what they are.
author: Epictetus

text: It is the mark of an educate mind to be able to entertain a thought without accepting it.
author: Aristotle

text: There are two things a person should never be angry at, what they can help, and what they cannot.
author: Plato

text: It's not what happens to you, but how you react to it that matter.
author: Epictetus

text: I don't need a friend who changes when I change and who nods when I nod, my shadow does that much better.
author: Plutarch

text: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
author: Aristotle

text: No one that encounters prosperity does not also encounter danger.
author: Heraclitus

text: No great mind has ever existed without a touch of madness.
author: Aristotle

text: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

text: A friend to all is a friend to none.
author: Aristotle

text: Those who know, do.  Those that understand, teach.
author: Aristotle

text: The educated differ from the uneducated as much as the living differ from the dead.
author: Aristotle

text: The high-minded man must care more for the truth, than for what people think.
author: Aristotle

text: Learning is not child's play; we cannot learn without pain.
author: Aristotle

text: For things we have to learn before we can do them, we learn by doing them.
author: Aristotle

text: The more you know, the more you know you don't know.
author: Aristotle

text: He who cannot be a good follower cannot be a good leader.
author: Aristotle

text: All men by nature desire knowledge.
author: Aristotle

text: Where your talents and the needs of the world cross; there lies your vocation.
author: Aristotle

text: We are what we repeatedly do.  Excellence, then is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

text: The soul never thinks without a mental picture.
author: Aristotle

text: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

text: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
author: Plato

text: Wise men speak because they have something to say; fools because the have to say something.
author: Plato

text: We can easily forgive a child who is afraid of the dark; the real tragedy of life is when men are afraid of light.
author: Plato

text: Human behavior flows from three main sources:  desire, emotion, and knowledge.
author: Plato

text: Thinking -- the talking of the soul with itself.
author: Plato

text: The measure of man is what he does with power.
author: Plato

text: Keep people from their history, and they are easily controlled.
author: Karl Marx

text: Thoughts become perception, perception becomes reality.  Alter thoughts, alter your reality.
author: William James

text: One of the penalties for refusing to participate in politics is that you end up being governed by inferiors.
author: Plato

text: Good people do not need laws to tell them to act responsibly, while bad people will find a way around the law.
author: Plato

text: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a harder battle.
author: Plato

text: We are twice armed, if we fight with truth.
author: Plato

text: To acquire knowledge, one must study, but to acquire wisdom, one must observe.
author: Marilyn vos Savant

text: The beginning is the most important part of the work.
author: Plato

text: Love is a serious mental disease.
author: Plato

text: If women are expected to do the same work as men, we must teach them the same.
author: Plato

text: Ignorance, the root and the stem of every evil.
author: Plato

text: There is no such thing as a lover's oath.
author: Plato

text: Hope is a walking dream.
author: Aristotle

text: Beware of false knowledge, it is more dangerous than ignorance.
author: George Bernard Shaw

text: The aim of the wise is to not to secure pleasure, but avoid pain.
author: Aristotle

text: Pleasure in the job puts perfection in the work.
author: Aristotle

text: To find yourself, think for yourself.
author: Socrates

text: Strong minds discuss ideas, average minds discuss events, weak minds discuss people.
author: Socrates

text: The roots of education are bitter, but the fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

text: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
author: Aristotle

text: Education is an ornament in prosperity, and a refuge in adversity.
author: Aristotle

text: The energy of the mind is the essence of life.
author: Aristotle

text: War is when the government tells you who the bad guy is. Revolution is when you decide that for yourself.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Everything you've ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Adair

text: If you are not your own doctor, you are a fool.
author: Hippocrates

text: Our food should be our medicine and medicine should be our food.
author: Hippocrates

text: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success. If you love what you are doing, you will be successful.
author: Albert Schweitzer

text: He who would trade liberty for some temporary security, deserves neither liberty nor security.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: If everyone is thinking alike, then no one is thinking.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Whoever would overthrow the liberty of a nation must begin by subduing the freeness of speech.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: We are all born ignorant, but one must work hard to remain stupid.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Make yourself sheep and the wolves will eat you.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: The only that is more expensive than education is ignorance.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Common sense without education, is better than education without common sense.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: Those who beat their swords into plowshares usually end up plowing for those who kept their swords.
author: Benjamin Franklin

text: What you leave behind is not what is engraved in stone monuments, but what is woven into the lives of others.
author: Pericles

text: The secret of happiness is freedom and the secrets of freedom is courage.
author: Thucydides

text: The strong do what the have to do and the weak do what the have to accept.
author: Thucydides

text: Knowledge without understanding is useless.
author: Thucydides

text: Hope is an expensive commodity. It makes better sense to be prepared.
author: Thucydides

text: Freedom is the sure possession of those alone who have the courage to defend it.
author: Pericles

text: Just because you do not take an interest in politics doesn't mean politics won't take an interest in you!
author: Pericles

text: If Athens shall appear great to you, consider then that her glories were purchased by valiant men, and by men who learned their duty.
author: Pericles

text: A woman's greatest glory is to be little talked about by men, whether for good or ill.
author: Pericles

text: For a man's counsel cannot have equal weight or worth, when he alone has no children to risk in the general danger.
author: Pericles

text: Be both a speaker of words and a doer of deeds.
author: Homer

text: If you serve too many masters, you'll soon suffer.
author: Homer

text: Sleep and Death, who are twin brothers.
author: Homer

text: Hateful to me as are the gates of Hell, is he who, hiding one thing in his heart, utters another.
author: Homer
